content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

Here's an implementation of the `q_and_a_extractor` function in Julia:

```julia
function q_ands_a_extractor(md)
    question_pattern = r"# Question\n(.*?)\n"
    answer_pattern = r"# Answer\n(.*?)"

    questions = []
    answers = []

    # Extract questions and answers using regex patterns
    for (i, line) in enumerate(md)
        if occursin(question_pattern, line)
            push!(questions, match(question_pattern, line)[2]))
        elseif occursin(answer_pattern, line)
            push!(answers, match(answer_pattern, line)[2])))
        end
    end

    # Combine questions and answers into tuples
    result = [(strip(q)), strip(ans))) for (q, ans) in zip(questions, answers)]
    
    return result
end
```

This function takes a markdown-formatted text `md` as input. It then extracts all the Question-Answer pairs using regex patterns and returns the answer tuples after stripping leading spaces and newlines.
